name: Integration and Differentiation calculator (With Graphs!!!)
description: Calculates the integral and derivative of a function and shows the combined graph of the original function and its derivative and integral. This graph is overlapped to make the analysis easier for Math students :)

section-0.title: Enter a mathematical function in terms of x ( Eg - x^1.01,x^2,... )

code:
import sympy as sp
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
import mecsimcalc as msc


def main(inputs):
    # Get the user input for the function
    expression_str = inputs['input_0']

    # Define the variable and the function
    x = sp.symbols('x')
    expression = sp.sympify(expression_str)

    # Calculate derivative and integral
    derivative = sp.diff(expression, x)
    integral = sp.integrate(expression, x)

    # Convert the expressions to Python functions
    func = sp.lambdify(x, expression, 'numpy')
    deriv_func = sp.lambdify(x, derivative, 'numpy')
    integral_func = sp.lambdify(x, integral, 'numpy')

    # Generate x values for plotting
    x_values = np.linspace(-10, 10, 400)

    # Evaluate the functions for the given x values
    y_values = func(x_values)
    deriv_values = deriv_func(x_values)
    integral_values = integral_func(x_values)
    

    # Plot the functions
    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
    plt.plot(x_values, y_values, label="Original Function")
    plt.plot(x_values, deriv_values, label="Derivative")
    plt.plot(x_values, integral_values, label="Integral")
    
    # Add labels and legend
    plt.xlabel("x")
    plt.ylabel("y")
    plt.title("Function, Derivative, and Integral")
    plt.legend()

    # Show the plot
    plt.grid(True)
    plt.show()

    #Get plot image and download link using mecsimcalc's print_plot function
    img, download = msc.print_plot(plt, download=True)

    return {
        'expression_string': expression_str,
        'expression': expression,
        'Derivative':derivative,
        'Integration':integral,
        "plot": img,
        "download": download
        }
output_html:
Derivation:


The derivative of the function is {{ outputs.Derivative }}


Integration:


The integral of the function is {{ outputs.Integration }}


The Plot:

{{ outputs.plot }}


{{outputs.download}}
docs_html:
• Integral & Derivative: Integral represents the area under the curve; derivative represents the rate of change.
  • Combined Graph: Original function, derivative, and integral overlapped on one graph.
  • Overlap for Analysis: Facilitates comparison of functions at each point for visual understanding.
  • Educational Tool: Designed for math students to comprehend calculus concepts visually.
  • Slope and Accumulated Area: Shows the connection between the original function, its derivative (slope), and integral (accumulated area).
  • Visual Aid: Simplifies analysis by presenting all three functions together, aiding in the study of calculus relationships.


Above shows the graph of the function x^2

related_app.code:
import sympy as sp
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
import mecsimcalc as msc


def main(inputs):
    # Get the user input for the function
    expression_str = inputs['input_0']

    # Define the variable and the function
    x = sp.symbols('x')
    expression = sp.sympify(expression_str)

    # Calculate derivative and integral
    derivative = sp.diff(expression, x)
    integral = sp.integrate(expression, x)

    # Convert the expressions to Python functions
    func = sp.lambdify(x, expression, 'numpy')
    deriv_func = sp.lambdify(x, derivative, 'numpy')
    integral_func = sp.lambdify(x, integral, 'numpy')

    # Generate x values for plotting
    x_values = np.linspace(-10, 10, 400)

    # Evaluate the functions for the given x values
    y_values = func(x_values)
    deriv_values = deriv_func(x_values)
    integral_values = integral_func(x_values)
    

    # Plot the functions
    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
    plt.plot(x_values, y_values, label="Original Function")
    plt.plot(x_values, deriv_values, label="Derivative")
    plt.plot(x_values, integral_values, label="Integral")
    
    # Add labels and legend
    plt.xlabel("x")
    plt.ylabel("y")
    plt.title("Function, Derivative, and Integral")
    plt.legend()

    # Show the plot
    plt.grid(True)
    plt.show()

    #Get plot image and download link using mecsimcalc's print_plot function
    img, download = msc.print_plot(plt, download=True)

    return {
        'expression_string': expression_str,
        'expression': expression,
        'Derivative':derivative,
        'Integration':integral,
        "plot": img,
        "download": download
        }

env.name: default-2023
env.dockerfile:
# !!! WARNING: directly editing this file may cause the build 
# or environment to fail. Only edit if you're familiar with 
# Dockerfiles and exercise extreme care when making changes !!!

# RUN Fetch assets from aws
FROM --platform=linux/x86_64 amazon/aws-cli:2.12.3 AS s3
RUN aws s3 cp --recursive s3://mecsimcalc-imagebuilder/env-1 /

# FROM Select Python version
FROM --platform=linux/x86_64 653199784281.dkr.ecr.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/python:3.8

# COPY/RUN install requirements.txt
COPY --from=s3 requirements.txt ${LAMBDA_TASK_ROOT}/ 
RUN pip install --upgrade pip && pip install -r ${LAMBDA_TASK_ROOT}/requirements.txt 

# ADD/COPY Files
RUN chmod -R 555 /home
